quirk.text: It is always cool to the touch, like stone kept in shade.
A faint scent of sea-salt clings to it no matter how often it’s cleaned.
In quiet rooms it seems to whisper a single word—never the same word twice.
Tiny leaf-motifs shift slightly when no one is watching.
It catches light strangely, as if remembering a different sun.
Soot gathers along its edges after arguments, even if no fire is near.
